description: Humanity's quest to leave the cradle and explore the void.

slides.title: History of Spaceflight
slides.content:
# The Space Race üöÄ

Cold War competition between USA and USSR.
- **Sputnik 1** (1957): First satellite (USSR).
- **Yuri Gagarin** (1961): First human in space (USSR).
- **Apollo 11** (1969): First humans on Moon (USA).

slides.title: Rocket Science
slides.content:
# Newton's Third Law üçé

"For every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction."
- Rocket throws gas One way, Rocket moves Other way.
- **Thrust**: The force pushing up.
- **Payload**: The stuff carrying up.

slides.title: Escape Velocity
slides.content:
# Breaking Free ‚õìÔ∏è

Speed needed to break free from a planet's gravity.
- Earth: ~11.2 km/s (25,000 mph).
- Requires immense energy, hence giant multi-stage rockets.

slides.title: Orbit Types
slides.content:
# Traffic Lanes üõ£Ô∏è

- **LEO (Low Earth Orbit)**: ISS, Hubble. (close, fast).
- **GEO (Geostationary)**: Stays over one spot (TV/Communication sats).
- **Polar**: Goes over poles (Spy/Weather sats).

slides.title: Apollo Program
slides.content:
# To the Moon üåï

NASA's program 1961-1972.
- **Saturn V**: Most powerful rocket ever flown.
- **Apollo 11**: Neil Armstrong & Buzz Aldrin walked on moon.
- Total of 12 men have walked on the moon.

slides.title: History Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Who was the first human in space?

slides.title: Space Shuttle
slides.content:
# Reusable Ship ‚úàÔ∏è

NASA's workhorse (1981-2011).
- Launched like a rocket, landed like a plane.
- Built the ISS.
- Two tragedies: Challenger and Columbia.

slides.title: International Space Station
slides.content:
# Lab in the Sky üõ∞Ô∏è

Habitable artificial satellite.
- Joint project (US, Russia, Europe, Japan, Canada).
- Research in microgravity (Medicine, Materials).
- Continuously occupied since 2000.

slides.title: Robotic Explorers 1
slides.content:
# The Voyagers üì°

**Voyager 1 & 2** (Launched 1977).
- Toured Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, Neptune.
- Carrying the "Golden Record" (Message to aliens).
- Now in Interstellar Space (First human objects to leave solar system).

slides.title: Robotic Explorers 2
slides.content:
# Mars Rovers ü§ñ

- Sojourner, Spirit, Opportunity, Curiosity, Perseverance.
- Geology labs on wheels.
- Hunting for signs of ancient water and life.

slides.title: Telescopes
slides.content:
# Eyes on Sky üî≠

- **Optical**: Hubble (Visible light).
- **Radio**: Arecibo (Radio waves).
- **Infrared**: James Webb (Heat/Early universe).
- Space telescopes avoid atmospheric blur.

slides.title: Falcon 9 & SpaceX
slides.content:
# New Era üîÑ

Reusable rockets landing vertically.
- Dramatically lowered cost of launch.
- Aiming for Mars (Starship).

slides.title: Propulsion Systems
slides.content:
# Going Faster üèéÔ∏è

- **Chemical**: Burning fuel (High thrust, low efficiency).
- **Ion Drive**: Shooting ions (Low thrust, high efficiency). Used for long deep space missions.
- **Solar Sails**: Pushed by light pressure.

slides.title: Tech Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Which propulsion is best for landing on a planet (needs high thrust)?

slides.title: Gravity Assist
slides.content:
# Slingshot üèπ

Using a planet's gravity to speed up (steal momentum).
- Voyager used Jupiter to fling to Saturn.
- Saves fuel and time.

slides.title: Hazards of Space
slides.content:
# Danger Zone ‚ö†Ô∏è

- **Vacuum**: No air.
- **Radiation**: Cancer risk.
- **Microgravity**: Bone/Muscle loss.
- **Debris**: Tiny junk hitting at bullet speeds.

slides.title: Future Missions
slides.content:
# What's Next? üîÆ

- **Artemis**: Return humans to Moon.
- **Mars Sample Return**: Bring rocks back.
- **Europa Clipper**: Visit Jupiter's ocean moon.

slides.title: SETI
slides.content:
# Hello? üëΩ

Search for Extraterrestrial Intelligence.
- Listening for radio signals.
- **Drake Equation**: Estimates N of civilizations.
- So far... silence.

slides.title: Exploration Summary
slides.content:
# Recap üìù

- Rockets overcome gravity.
- **Robots** lead the way (Voyager, Rovers).
- **Humans** follow (Apollo, ISS, Artemis).
- Exploration drives technology and inspires humanity.
